original: skye bo thams cad la yang byams pa ste skye ba dang rga ba dang nab dang 'chi ba'i zug rngus mnar zhing myos pa rnams la snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi blor byas nas man dag 'di las sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mtshungs pas
analyzed: skye bo thams cad la yang byams pa ste skye ba dang rga ba dang nab dang 'chi ba'i zug rngus mnar zhing myos pa rnams la snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms kyi blor byas nas man dag 'di las sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mtshungs pas
translated: Having made a mind of love for all beings, compassion for those tormented by the pain of birth, aging, sickness, and death, and a mind of joy and equanimity, one should view this world as similar to an illusion or a dream.

original: shin tu mchog tu ma lus pa rnams stong pa nyid du rnam par bltas nas 'gro ba rnams kyi rnam par shes pa dang lus gcig tu sngags pas mdun du rnam par bsgoms te /

translated: Having thoroughly and completely seen everything as emptiness, the consciousness and body of beings are imagined by the mantrin as one in front.

original: de nas de rnams kyi yang aa yig dkar po la ri bong 'dzin pa'i gzugs su gyur nas /

original: rang gi sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis phyogs so so nas khams gsum yang snang bar mdzad par bsams nas sna tshogs chu skyes kyi ze'u 'brul rnam par dangs pa'i zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa /

translated: Having imagined that the light rays from the seed syllables illuminate the three realms in all directions, [the deities] are seated on variegated lotus seats, on seats of pure moon discs.

original: kun nas ser zhing ser ba dang / kun nas dkar zhing dkar ba dang / dmar ba'i zhal gsum la spyan gsum gsum gyis spras pa /

original: bskyed nas / gang gi tshe ngal na de'i tshe mu tig gi phreng ba bzhin du brtan zhing 'od zer shin tu rgya chen po rab tu 'bar bas rang gi snying gar zla ba'i steng du mtshungs pa med par bsams nas bzlas par bya'o //
